Character

Class SmartTargettingEnemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.Element
      • Character.Enemy
        • Character.SmartTargettingEnemy

  • public class SmartTargettingEnemy
extends Enemy
    Smart targeting enemies uses BFS to find player and chase.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Miles Singleton, Andy Kuo

      • SmartTargettingEnemy

                            int newY)
                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Creates a new instance of a smart enemy.
        Parameters:
        newX - The X position for the enemy.
        newY - The Y position for the enemy.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Tells the system that this method could cause an error of this type.

    • Method Detail

      • getPath

        public Path getPath(GameBoard gb,
                    int x,
                    int y,
                    int playerX,
                    int playerY)
        Gets the path the enemy follows towards the player.
        Parameters:
        gb - The gameboard info. As the enemy can't go through other elements.
        x - Enemy's x-coordinate.
        y - Enemy's y-coordinate.
        playerX - Player's x-coordinate.
        playerY - Player's y-coordinate.
        Returns:
        The next path the enemy will follow.

      • setPaths

        public void setPaths(GameBoard gb,
                     int x,
                     int y,
                     int playerX,
                     int playerY,
                     int counter,
                     java.util.ArrayList<Path> path)
        Set the path by the Breadth-first-search algorithms.
        Parameters:
        gb - The gameboard instance.
        x - The x-coordinate of enemy.
        y - The y-coordinate of enemy.
        playerX - The player's x-coordinate.
        playerY - The player's y-coordinate.
        counter - The steps taken from the enemy's position.
        path - The list of path information.

      • checkVisited

        public boolean checkVisited(java.util.ArrayList<Path> p,
                            int x,
                            int y,
                            int counter)
        Check whether the list includes the same path.
        Parameters:
        p - The list to be checked.
        x - The x-coordinate of enemy.
        y - The y-coordinate of enemy.
        counter - The number of visited cells.
        Returns:
        True if its in the list else false.

      • isAdjacent

        private boolean isAdjacent(Path firstPath,
                           Path secondPath)
        Checks whether two paths are adjacent to each other.
        Parameters:
        firstPath - First path to compare.
        secondPath - Second path to compare to.
        Returns:
        True if they are adjacent, else false.
